result.execSummary:
The defendant Taylor W. Bryant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  The bond of $150.00 has been applied towards the costs.  The remaining 
 balance shall be paid directly to the Taylor County Clerk of Courts at the rate of $50.00 a month beginning November 1, 2022.  Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment being entered against you, tax intercept, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant shall have no contact with the victims.

Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victims within 30 days of sentencing and shall be preapproved by probation.  Defendant shall successfully complete a domestic violence class.  Defendant shall at agent's discretion complete his HSED/GED or adult diploma.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Taylor W. Bryant

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Taylor W. Bryant
Current: W6726 Apple Avenue, Medford, WI 54451 United States  (Effective: 09-12-2022)
Prior: 304 S. Main Street, Apt. E, Medford, WI 54451

9:03 AM Defendant Taylor W. Bryant in court, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas Grant Smith in court for Taylor W. Bryant.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied. Plea agreement recited into the record. Case No. 22CF41 - Written waiver of preliminary hearing filed.  Court questions defendant.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a crime was committed and binds defendant over for trial.  Information to be filed.  No objection to Information being filed later. Case No. 22CF41 -  Plea of no contest to count 1 and Count 2 -  child neglect  - 948.21.  Case No. 22CF61 - Plea of no contest.  Plea colloquy. Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists for the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 2 in 22CF41 and Count 2 in 22CF61.  Court makes a finding of guilt in Count 1. The remaining counts in 22CF61 are dismissed and read in.  Statement by Attorney Fuhr.  Statement by Attorney Smith.   Court orders in Count 1 a deferred entry of Judgment for a period of two years with standard conditions and parenting class.  Upon successful completion the charge will be dismissed.  Count 2 - 22CF41 court orders a $318.00 fine and $200.00 DNA surcharge.  Count 2 in 22CF61 - court orders a withheld sentence and placement on probation for one year with conditions of court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; domestic abuse surcharge; letter of apology to the victim; complete a domestic violence class; no contact with victim; complete his HSED/GED or adult diploma.  Court converts $5,000.00 cash to a $5,000.00 signature; booking; no contact with EAS and no unsupervised contact.  22CF41 - 6 days credit - 22CF61 2 days credit  - Payment plan of $50.00 a month beginning November 1, 2022

1:32 PM . Defendant Taylor W. Bryant in court.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nick Smith appears for the defendant.  Victim notification has been complied. Waived further reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Preliminary hearing requested with time limits waived freely and voluntarily.  Bond continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

2:30p.m. Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Victim notification has been complied. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $150 cash bond with conditions to comply with the booking process and to have no contact with S.L.S dob-11-18-1996. State also requests to start bond revocation proceedings in 22CF41. Court ordered bond with conditions as requested. Court orders clerk to begin bond revocation proceedings in 22CF41.  Initial appearance set for September 6, 2022 at 1:30 p.m.-JN
